Holding one of the step keys down (to step as quickly as possible) can cause a 
NPE in the step action's job.

This is the stack entry in the .log file

!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.runtime 4 2 2005-07-28 10:39:14.783
!MESSAGE An internal error occurred during: "Step Over".
!STACK 0
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at 
org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.actions.AbstractDebugActionDelegate$DebugRequestJ
ob.run(AbstractDebugActionDelegate.java:143)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:76)

This problem appears to be caused by the following:
1) The debug core is reusing the same instance of the background job to carry 
out the action.
2) Just before scheduling the job the selected elements are "set" in the 
instance of the job. then the job is scheduled.
3) if a second job is scheduled before the first has had a chance to run then 
the job instance will be set to the 2nd set of selected elements.   
>> the first set will be lost
4) the first job will then run and execute the action for the 2nd set
5) the second job will then run and get a null set of selected elements (hence 
the npe error)
